reviewText: I can't say that about most Christmas movies. Usually they contain at least moments of cringe worthy sappy-ness. But the Christmas Angel is a perfect blend of family and holiday that will touch your heart.Olivia (who is adorable!) makes a Christmas wish for her mom to find a husband. And though this movie contains some romance (slowly budding and heart-stirring!) it is more about the discovery of God's hand behind the scenes and the amazing way He works.I do not cry too often while watching Christmas movies (unless it's to despair of the two hours I wasted just for an ending too corny to be believed), but this one brought out a few tears!A great movie. And one to be watched again!

reviewText: First off, I love Christmas and watch most of the movies on Hallmark and Lifetime. Every year, I wind up buying one or two that stood out among the rest. I rarely purchase the dvd unless I've seen it first, but bought this one because of all the glowing reviews...and the fact that I love Teri Polo and Kevin Sorbo in most things. This movie, however, left me flat. It was soooo...slow to the point of being extremely tedious. I understand many loved it for its Christian theme, which is fine. But, a good Christmas movie has to have more than that. A good storyline, humor, romance, and a script that moves at a good pace so the audience isn't falling asleep in their chairs. Everyone was grumpy and snippy for the first hour of this film. I've never seen so many unhappy and morose people in one place. I know I'm not in the majority here. I feel a little guilty about saying these things, but for me a holiday movie isn't just about the message...it has to entertain as well. I would like to praise the little girl who played Olivia, however. She did a great job with what she had to work with. Pretty sure we'll see more of her in the future.

reviewText: I have been a long-time fan of Terri Polo, and I have to add "Christmas Angel" to the list of her accomplishments.  This very warm and touching film also includes wonderful performances by Della Reese and Kevin Sorbo.  Izabela Vidovic plays the role of the little girl Olivia and gives a stellar performance.  I highly recommend this movie for anyone wanting to celebrate the true meaning of Christmas.

reviewText: This 2012 DVD is a nice Christmas flick. It is about 1 1/2 hours in length and begins with a young boy in class, reading his "Impossible Christmas wish".  It takes place in a small town with an abandoned, decaying vintage house.  But wait -- is there someone in the house?  Is it a magic house, where dreams come true?It's a nice family story about the perserverance of a little girl with a big heart, an aging once-famous celebrity, and a little town where wishes really do come true.Della Reese stars, along with Kevin Sorbo and Teri Polo.Note - This is a very God-based movie.  If that offends you, please step away from this DVD now.
summary: A Small Town, Where Wishes Really Do Come True
Title: N/A

reviewText: Olivia Mead and her classmates have been given an assignment to give oral reports about their impossible Christmas wish. Olivia's wish is for someone else, and she also wants to help other children's wishes come true. Is the run down house in the neighborhood a wishing house? Is it occupied by an angel who will grant these wishes?I've been in the mood to watch Christmas movies and listen to Christmas music for a couple weeks now. I heard about this movie while watchingGame Over, an episode of Tia & Tamera on Style Network. I looked forward to seeing it for two reasons: It is a Christmas movie. And watching Tia & Tamera has shown me how hard Tamera has worked to be cast in a television show or movie. When she announced on her reality show that she got the part, I was very happy for her.Christmas Angel cast: Teri Polo (Melinda Mead), Kevin Sorbo (Nathan Davis), Della Reese (Elsie), Tamera Mowry-Housley (Daphney Conroy), Jaiden Kaine (Jeb Conroy), Izabela Vidovic (Olivia Mead), Tyler Humphrey (Lucas Conroy), Lisa Arnold (Mrs. Bell), Rob Boltin (Mr. Brennan), Toby Nichols (Bully). It was nice to see Della Reese after so many years. And child actor Izabela Vidovic - this little lady is talented.It seems most Christmas movies are about Santa and reindeer and elves and magical things. I'm okay with those; I like make believe. Wishes are granted in this movie, but not in any magical way (I'll leave it at that, don't want to tell too much). Christmas Angel is a film I really enjoyed more than most, because characters believed in God. It was nice to see praying at the dinner table and at bedtime and to hear Scripture quoted.My favorite characters: Olivia (She was an intelligent little girl and she made me smile) and Elsie (Her story was interesting and she gave me things to think about).My favorite line: Some things only God can do. Only God knows how to help.Christmas Angel is a good family movie. Yes, there is one child bullying another; however, the way it was done I felt bad for the child being bullied, of course, but I also felt bad for the bully - the reason for his actions is clear. Also, there's a beautiful song playing during the closing credits - Mandisa is singing `Somebody's Angel'. I highly recommend this film!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: The Christmas Angel is a story of compassion, friendship, and love.  Della Reese is as usual acts her part with conviction and a determination to make it lifelike.  There are not too many Christmas stories with an emphasis on the spiritual nature of the season.  this show does just that.  I enjoyed it immensely.knight68
summary: A good show with a great message.

reviewText: WRITTEN BY BRENDA MUMFORD. FIRST OFF, LET ME AGAIN REPEAT THAT I ADORE KEVIN SORBO AND I WATCH EVERYHTING THAT HE DOES. BUT THIS MOVIE LEFT ME FLAT. I AGREE WITH DOUG ON HERE - I LOVE CHRISTMAS MOVIES AND WATCH AS MANY AS I CAN DURING THE SEASON. BUT THIS MOVIE LEFT ME BORED SILLY. KEVIN'S ON SCREEN TIME WAS NOT WHAT I EXPECTED AND THOUGH I UNDERSTAND THE PAIN HE WAS GOING THROUGH HIS CHARACTER WAS SO FLAT AND ONE DIMENSIONAL IT WAS ALMOST PAINFUL TO WATCH HIM. I DIDN'T FEEL THAT THERE WAS ANY CHEMISTRY  BETWEEN HE AND TERI POLO SO I DIDN'T REALLY BELIEVE THEIR 'ROMANCE'. I LIKED THE CHRISTIAN THEME BUT THE MOVIE ITSELF FELL FLAT FOR ME. GLAD I DIDN'T BUY THIS ONE BEFORE WATCHING IT ON TV. IF YOU WANT TO SEE KEVIN IN AN EXCELLENT CHRISTMAS MOVIE CHECK OUT "THE SANTA SUIT".
summary: LOVE SORBO BUT NOT THIS MOVIE

reviewText: I love Christmas movies because they are family friendly and they have wonderful messages. Christmas Angel is no exception-its message is very simple and one the whole family can relate to-all things are possible when you believe and trust in God. The cast is outstanding,most notably Della Resse as Miss Elsie and Kevin Sorbo as Dr.Nathan Davis,a man who needs another chance in life,but doesn't know it-yet. I know your family will enjoy this movie and will want to watch it again and again!
summary: A wonderful movie for the entire family!
